result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah O Heesch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $300.00 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office. Payment plan of $25.00 per month to begin on 2/2/16 and on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be warrant.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Courts office. To be paid through payment plan also.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah O Heesch
